summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

- Recalls the purposes and principles of the UN Charter and reaffirms respect for Ukraine's sovereignty, independence, and territorial integrity.

- Expresses grave concern at the violence in eastern Ukraine.

- Reaffirms Resolution 2166 (2014).

- Endorses the "Package of measures for the Implementation of the Minsk Agreements" adopted on 12 February 2015 (Annex I).

- Welcomes the Declaration by the President of the Russian Federation, Ukraine, France, and Germany in support of the Minsk Agreements.

- Calls on all parties to fully implement the Package of measures, including a comprehensive ceasefire.

- Decides to remain seized of the matter.

The Package of measures includes:

1. Immediate and comprehensive ceasefire in certain areas of Donetsk and Luhansk regions by 15 February 2015, 12 a.m. local time.

2. Withdrawal of heavy weapons by both sides within 14 days.

3. Effective monitoring and verification of the ceasefire and withdrawal of heavy weapons by OSCE.

4. Dialogue on local elections and future regime of certain areas.

5. Pardon and amnesty for persons involved in events in certain areas.

6. Release and exchange of hostages and detained persons.

7. Safe access to humanitarian assistance.

8. Definition of modalities for resuming socioeconomic ties.
The Security Council, 
Recalling its resolution 2118 (2014), 
Reaffirming its commitment to the sovereignty, independence, 
territorial integrity and inviolability of the borders of Ukraine, 
1. Endorses the Package of Measures for the Implementation of the 
Minsk Agreements (the “Minsk Package”) 
2. Urges all parties to ensure its full implementation 
3. Calls upon Ukraine to continue dialogue with a view to a peaceful 
resolution of the situation 
4. To stabilize the situation and create an environment conducive to 
the peaceful resolution of the situation 
Ukraine shall : 
- Pay all utility bills on time 
- Re-instate taxation within Ukraine’s legal framework 
5. Ukraine to re-instate control over its banking system segment 
in conflict-affected areas 
6. Int’l mechanism may be established to facilitate such transfers 
7-8. No text 
9. Ukraine to reinstate control over state border in conflict area 
- Starting day 1 after local elections 
- Ending after comprehensive political settlement 
- Local elections in Donetsk & Luhansk regions 
- Based on Ukrainian law & constitutional reform 
- To be finalized by end-2015 
- Consultations with representatives of Donetsk & Luhansk 
10. All foreign armed formations, equipment & mercenaries to 
withdraw from Ukraine 
- Under OSCE monitoring 
- Disarmament of all illegal groups 
11. Constitutional reform in Ukraine 
- New constitution by end-2015 
- Decentralization as key element 
- Reference to specificities of Donetsk & Luhansk 
- Permanent legislation on special status 
12. Local elections to be discussed & agreed with 
representatives of Donetsk & Luhansk 
- In Trilateral Contact Group framework 
- According to OSCE standards 
- Monitored by OSCE/ODIHR 
13. Enhance Trilateral Contact Group 
- Through working groups on Minsk agreements 
- Comprising same participants 
Trilateral Contact Group: 
- Ambassador Heidi Tagliavini 
- L.D. Kuchma (Ukraine) 
- M.Yu. Zurabov (Russian Federation) 
- A.W. Zakharchenko 
- I.W. Plotnitski 
Specific measures 
- Exemption from punishment 
- Linguistic self-determination 
- Participation in public prosecution & courts 
- Economic development agreements 
- State support for social & economic development 
- Cross-border cooperation 
- Creation of people’s police units 
- Protection for deputies & officials
The President of the Russian Federation, Ukraine, France, and Germany reaffirm respect for Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity. They commit to a peaceful settlement and endorse the "Package of Measures for the Implementation of the Minsk Agreements" adopted on February 12, 2015. They will use their influence to facilitate implementation. Germany and France will provide technical expertise to restore the banking system in conflict-affected areas. They support trilateral talks between the EU, Ukraine, and Russia on energy and trade issues. Leaders commit to a joint humanitarian and economic space based on international law and OSCE principles. An oversight mechanism in the Normandy format will be established to monitor implementation, convening at regular intervals with senior officials from foreign ministries.
